Name: Warrior Kings of Ireland
Description:
Card & Dice Game for 2-6 Players. Theme: The Political Cauldron of Warring factions of Ireland in the 10th and 11th Centuries. A game of constantly shifting Alliances. 
Raid and lay siege to your opponents. Slaughter your Foes and take all their Gold. Simple Rules and Quick Play. A copy of the rules is available for free at:  http://www.angelfire.com/games2/warpspawn/WKOI.html

Name: Rehab: A Wild Drinking Game
Description:
Description from the Kheper Games website:

You and the other players are raging alcoholics. You try and try and try to correct your drinking problem in REHAB, but you keep falling off the wagon. Whether it's a trip to Willy's Bar and Grill, Club Swank, the New Year's Eve Party or the Fraternity Party, you just can't seem to resist temptation. You'll travel around the gameboard landing in and falling out of REHAB until finally someone successfully defeats his or her addiction to alcohol (by collecting five gold stars). Along your road to recovery, you may have to reveal personal information about yourself, sing your favorite television theme song or even dance with a lampshade on your head. You may have a drunken hookup, develop cirrhosis of the liver or even get thrown in jail for drunk and disorderly conduct. You are an alcoholic and you're expected to act like one, and that includes lots of drinks. For 2-6 adults.

Name: Trails to Tremble By
Description: This Whitman game is subtitled "The Scarey {sic} Crossroads Game." This game was truly ahead of its time: it is a hexagonal tile laying game, with no board, for children. Each player selects 10 "spooky" tiles of either witches, monsters, ghosts, or buzzards, plus one crossroad and one tombstone. The first player then picks one of the 40 road tiles and places it in the center of the table. Each player then adds a road piece, making sure the road continues without a dead end or circling into itself. Every time you form a three-sided space, you fill it with one of your spooky tiles, making sure it does not block the road. After you have added 5 of your spooky tiles, add the tombstone, and then the rest of your pieces. The winner is the first to use all their pieces and add the Haunted House tile to the road.

Name: Dunce
Description:
The Dunce game is similar to Jumbolino, only in reverse. In Jumbolino players roll dice to be the first to construct a figure. In "Dunce," players spin a teetotum that has pictures of the dunce pieces as well as a lucky horseshoe pic. If a player puts together the whole dunce (stool, body, head, and cap - in that order), he/she is eliminated from the game; the winner is the last eliminated. The box also lists Rules for Teenagers and Adults, saying that they can play the old game of "Ghost" by adding letters to a word, with the player who completes the word having to add a part to his toy dunce.

The die has six sides. Two stools, one body, one head, one dunce's cap, and a lucky horseshoe. You have to assemble the body in order. If you get the lucky horseshoe then you skip a turn, but all your opponents have to put on their next body part.

This game is also similar to ScareCrow, which also has players building a figure in order, except that in that game the player who finishes first is the winner.

Name: BWAH!: Still Flyin'
Description: An expasion for BWAH! The game BWAH! is based on the game BANG! re-themed for the "Firefly" universe created by Joss Whedon. Not a standalone game, "Only a hoe-tze duh pee goo would try to play with only these cards."  This expansion includes 9 more characters and 9 more cards.  The characters cards feature some minor characters in the TV series including a Reaver character.  In addition, two new symbols affecting game play are introduced.

Name: Criterium Degli Assi
Description: Italian cycling game that was released by a small publisher from Milan in the 1940's. Although the game mechanics are very straightforward, the game board features very nice graphics, especially considering the age of the game.

Name: La Gran Vuelta Ciclista en Casa
Description:
Independent expensive Spanish cycling game that looks very good. It has 4 double sided boards and even innovative aspects like a service car (for each cycling team) and even road signs and a tunnel.

With all these elements and others that I do not display here (in the booklet there are examples of how to set up different stages), this game is deceptively simple (not to say silly). The rules can basically be summarized as:

- roll one die,
- move your rider
- follow the instructions on the board if any
- if you fall on a question square, draw one question card and try to answer
- when the stage is over, fill up a lot of boring classification sheets while you pretend you are enjoying yourself
- play next stage

Name: Le Guidon d'Or
Description: Each player has one cyclist. At each turn the player rolls the dice and move his or her cyclist. The board has 63 squares, the kilometer-mark squares double your throw. The game is like The Game of Goose. The first player who lands exactly on space 63 wins the game.

Name: Itzuli Mitzuli
Description: Beautiful and very rare cycling game produced in the Basque area of Spain in the 1970s, with an important nationalist vindication component. There are six boards representing the seven territories (Behe Nafarra and Xiberua share a board) vindicated by Basque nationalism. The rules are in Euskara (Basque), Breton, Spanish, Catalan and French. The components of the game are quite geometrical: triangular wooden pegs represent the riders and the graphics on the cards are quite abstract.

Name: Total War
Description:
Games Research/Design (GR/D) returns Europa to its roots and revisits the best selling Europa title Fire in the East. The new game covers the same time period as the older ones (summer of 1941 to the spring of 1942) but uses a completely new Soviet OB, a new map, and the latest rules for the Europa system.

Total War gives the Axis player the opportunity to see if he can improve on the massive offensive that pocketed and captured millions of Soviet soldiers. Can you take Moscow or Leningrad? Or are you condemned to suffer the Soviet winter short of victory? The Soviet player must build a strategic reserve large enough to stop the advancing Axis forces and throw them out of Russia. The Soviet player is aided by massive reinforcements that allow him to form new defensive lines in an attempt to slow down or stop the Axis armor thrusts.

Total War is a historical game on the German invasion of the Soviet Union, from summer 1941 to spring 1942. It charts the titanic struggle of the largest ground campaign in World War II, from the Axis offensives that brought the Germans to the gates of Moscow to the Soviet winter counteroffensive that hurled them back.

Total War is a two-player game. One side controls the forces of Germany and its allies while the other controls the forces of the Soviet Union. The maps cover Eastern Europe and the western USSR from the Arctic Ocean to the Black Sea, from the plains of Poland to the steppes along the Volga River. Ground units represent corps, divisions, brigades, regiments, and battalions. Air units represent groups of 40 to 120 aircraft. Naval units represent task forces of warships.

Total War is a complete remake and updating of the classic Europa game, Fire in the East. The game’s Soviet order of battle makes extensive use of formerly secret Kremlin information on the Red Army forces that fought the war. The game includes a Soviet order of battle for all of the USSR from 1939 to 1942 and is the more comprehensive game OB ever published on the Red Army in peace and war. The Axis order of battle also is updated, reflecting new research since the publication of Fire in the East. The rules for Total War incorporate the latest rules for the Europa system, with on-demand air power, armor effects, combined arms, and much more, recreating both the German blitzkrieg that captured entire Soviet armies and the Soviet deep operations that nearly splintered the invaders in the depth of the Russian winter.

(from Games Research/Design (GR/D) web site:)


The box, counters and maps were printed and sold without complete rules.

Name: Flippit
Description:
Flippit ... the word game you'll flip over!

A multi-player competitive solitaire alphabet card game of luck that reinforces correct spelling for kids of all ages.

Choose a name or word ... shuffle and deal only those cards letter-side down in a row.

Pick a card, any card - and, to follow the letter positions and spell it out ... flip it ... the more cards flipped and correctly repositioned in their proper spelling sequence, the more points acquired.

The most points scored, wins the game.

Name: 1829 Conversion Kit
Description:
1829 Conversion Kits were published to allow owners of the 1829 Conversion Kit to play the other 18xx games without having to buy another complete game as many of the parts were common to both the Southern and the Northern games.  As such, the Conversion Kits are not standalone games, but rather contains those parts unique to the other 1829 [Northern or Southern] - the board and the shares for the companies.  A copy of 1829 Northern Board is required to use the 1829 Southern Conversion Kit or alternatively a Southern Board can be used with a Northern Conversion Kit.

The Conversion Kits can be differentiated from a full copy of 1829 by the presence of either a large sticker to the right of the 1829 name on the box stating "Conversion Kit. This is not a complete game." [Southern Conversion Kit] or a larger diagonal sticker across the front of the box [Northern and Southern Conversion Kits]. See pictures.  The inevitable scars left after removal of either sticker is the largest sign that this is the Conversion Kit and not the full game.  However, on the side of the box where the Number of Players and Playing Time is indicated, there is also a sticker covering the Serial Number [Southern Kit] or no number at all [both kits].

Name: Les plus Beaux Tableaux du Monde
Description: Educational card game by Nathan about painters. The game contains 48 cards with lots of info about paintings and painters on it.

Name: Minéraux et Roches
Description: Educational card game with an archeology theme that appeared in the '80s about rocks and minerals. Game contains 48 cards with lots of info on it.

Name: Zambezy
Description:
Zambezy ... a board game of strategic placement and points accumulation using luck of the draw and tactics.

The object is to accumulate points by placing or exposing pieces of the same colour on four adjacent spaces to form squares.

Pieces may be placed on top of others but only on opposing-colour pieces - maximum: 4 high.

Only same-colour pieces on the top tier of any 4 adjacent spaces forming a square score points.

There are 3 different colour exception pieces ... that may help or hinder!

Players only win points with their own colour pieces - even when one is placed by the opponent completing their square(s).

The player with the most points wins.

Contents
milled beech wood playing board (24cm x 38cm) with burnt in (branded) playing surface
71 custom-made plastic playing pieces: 1 clear + 1 green + 3 orange + 33 blue + 33 red
felt base
cloth bag

Name: Tous pour un Maillot
Description: French cycling boardgame that appeared in the '80s or early '90s. The green gameboard has France on it with a road that represents the Tour de France. The game has wonderful metal cyclists that in 4 different colors, each for a player. There also is a cyclist with a yellow jersey to represent the leader and a rider with a blue cap to represent the leader in the Dauphiné Liberé race. The game has roll and move mechanics and it comes with 2 dice.

Name: Quel est ce bruit?
Description: Quel est ce bruit? (What is this noise?) is an educational game for learning French (intended for those whose native language is French).  It consists of 6 boards of various scenes (e.g. camping scene).  Using a cassette tape, you would play sounds/words and place disks as you identified these.

Name: Tumbling Bob the Builder
Description: In this game players add buckets to Bob the Builder's ladder trying not to tip him over.  The object is to be the first to get rid of all your buckets.  Targeted at the 4+ audience.

Name: De Wraak van Seth: Papyrus
Description: A long time ago Gods were disputing who would rule the world. Horus would claim power on Egypt and Seth on the desert. Seth wasn't content with this and would soon take revenge. This game is based upon a comic book and cartoon of Papyrus. It's aimed at children starting from age 6.

Name: Scenario Sports
Description:
"The Game You Play, While The Game Is On"

From 2 and up to an unprecedented 50 players, ages 8 & up of all genders, will have a blast winning play money throughout the telecast. For example:

When a soft drink commercial is shown......YOU WIN MONEY!
If a commentator says a certain word.........YOU WIN MONEY!
If an official/referee falls down...................YOU WIN MONEY!

There are 51 fun filled scenario cards in the game and when a "scenario" occurs and you hold the corresponding scenario card, you will win the amount of money printed on the card...The player with the most money at the end of the game, WINS!

The special feature of this game is that YOU can choose on how long you want to play the scenario game. You may play by periods/quarters, the whole game or YOU may set a TIME LIMIT on the scenario game.

You do NOT have to play through a 3 hour telecast.
Another special feature of the game is that you may start or stop play at any point during the telecast of the game.
To view the 4 easy direction on how to play, you may visit our web-site at http://www.scenariosports.com

Name: Kong Power Slam Battle Card Game
Description:
Each player begins with a hand of five cards. The cards have either a number (from 2-8- some of which also have special powers) or a picture of Kong. In each round of the battle, players simultaneously selects a card and places it face down in front of him. The cards are then revealed and, in general, the card with the higher number wins the round (with some exceptions due to Kong cards and special powers.)
The winner of the round either moves the Kong figure to the first space on his side of the board if he did not win the last round or advances Kong a space if he won the last round. The loser gets to draw a card. In the case of a tie, both players draw two cards.
A player must win three rounds [b]in a row[/b] in order to win the game. If the deck is exhausted before someone has won 3 in a row, the player who has won the most rounds (tallied by keeping the cards from won battles in front of him) wins. A player can also lose by running out of cards.

Name: Monopoly: Cricket Australia Charity
Description:
Monopoly variant.
UK edition board square: replacement.
Mayfair: Don Bradman; Park Lane: Steve Waugh; 
Regent St: Ricky Ponting; Oxford St: Shane Warne; Bond St: Glenn McGrath;
Coventry St: Adam Gilchrist; Leicester Square: Justin Langer; Picadilly: Matthew Hayden;
The Strand: Mike Hussey; Fleet St: Andrew Symonds; Trafalgar Square: Simon Katich;
Vine St: Brett Lee; Bow St: Michael Clarke; Marlborough St: Shane Watson;
Pall Mall: Damien Martyn; Northumberland Ave: Jason Gillespie; Whitehall: Michael Kasprowicz;
Euston St: Shaun Tait; Pentonville Rd: Daniel Cullen; Angel Islington: Stuart Clark;
Whitechapel: Brad Hogg; Old Kent Rd: Stuart McGill;
King's Cross: Mark Taylor; Marylebone: Greg Chappell; Fenchurch St: Ian Chappell; Liverpool St: Allan Border
Electric Company: Ashes Urn; Water Works: Allan Border Medal;
Income Tax: LBW; Super Tax: Caught Behind;
Chance: One Day; Community Chest: Test.

Name: Monopoly: Dallas Cowboys
Description:
The historic 'Dallas Cowboys and the world’s most popular board game have teamed up to create the ultimate fantasy for fans of all ages. This incredible NFL franchise has won a phenomenal five Super Bowls and its roster includes some of the greatest gridiron players of all time. Buy, sell and trade the most significant players, coaches and historic moments in the history of the Cowboys, including Michael Irvin, Randy White, Bob Lilly and Tom Landry. Get ready to wheel and deal your way to the ultimate Cowboys team of all time!

Comes complete with 6 collectible pewter tokens: Cowboys Cheerleader,  Football, Referee’s Whistle, Quarterback, Cowboys Helmet and Linebacker.

Dimensions: 26 × 51 × 4 cm
Ages: 8+
Players: 2-6

Name: Monopoly: New England Patriots Collector's
Description:
Experience Patriots excitement in and out of the stadium in the New England Patriots Collector's Edition of the Monopoly game. Buy, sell and trade the Patriots all-time greatest players from Tom Brady, Steve Grogan and the legendary John Hannah.

Own the most memorable games like Berry the Bears, Squish the Fish and the Snow Plow Game.

Compete to own the ultimate Patriots team in this completely customized version of the world’s best selling board game.

Dimensions: 26 × 51 × 4 cm
Ages: 8+
Players: 2-6

Pewter Tokens:

     Quarterback
     Linebacker
     Football
     Cheerleader
     Patriots Helmet
     Whistle

Name: Minus 13
Description:
Minus 13 is easiest described as a multi-player shut the box.  Players take turns rolling 3 dice and removing colored chips from hexagonal pyramid that is made from six triangular parts.  The players total up the numbers on the dice and remove the colored chip that sits on the corresponding number.  If there is no chip left on that number then the player takes any number of chips from numbers that add up to the total of the roll.  When a 13 is rolled the player must take chip that sits on top of the pyramid that is worth negative 13 points.  If a player is unable to take chips that add up to his or her number (ie. another 13 is rolled) then they must pass one of their colored chips to the person on their left.  In this way the "minus 13" chip can be passed on.

At the end of the game, each player rolls dice to determine how many points each colored chip is worth.  The player holding the "minus 13" chip subtracts the appropriate amount of points and the person with the most points wins.

Name: Scooby-Doo! Mystery Card Game
Description: Scooby Doo Mystery Card Game, capture a villain but don't get caught.  Features, Scooby and the gang and of course the villains.  For ages 4 and up.

Name: El Tour
Description: Spanish cycling game based on the Tour de France. The game uses dice but also some cards that are used for a sprint, there also is a flat tire card. The game also includes a double sided board with different stages, it even includes some roadsigns.

Name: World Safari
Description:
World Safari is a combination of 2 educational games on the same game board. It is a geography-based trivia game designed to encourage children to learn about the various sizes, locations and characteristics of many countries in the world. It also seeks to familiarize players with the map of the world.

One game consists of players naming countries and capitals on the maps for points. A first-time answer scores more points than a second-time answer coming after a prompt. Scores are tallied when all the countries have been named.

The other game is played Cranium-style, where players must answer certain trivia questions aided by Visual Aid cards that ask for the location or name of certain buildings. When these are answered correctly, the player moves forward on the board. The player to reach the Finish square first is the winner.

Name: La Batalla de las Ardenas
Description:
The Ardennes Offensive, officially named the Battle of the Ardennes by the U.S. Army (and known to the general public as the Battle of the Bulge), started on December 16, 1944. The goal of these operations as planned by the Germans was to split the British and American Allied line in half, capturing Antwerp and then proceeding to encircle and destroy four Allied armies, forcing the Western Allies to negotiate a peace treaty in the Axis' favor.

This NAC game represents the important battle of WWII.

Name: 6-TAC
Description: 6-TAC is a six player version of TAC. Most of the rules are identical to those for regular TAC: as in TAC, players play in teams - three teams of two, or two teams of three - racing to bring their marbles into Home. Movement is governed by cards, each player receiving five or six cards per round of play. A variety of special cards enliven the tactical play.

Name: Tic Tac Tony
Description:
Take turns placing your disc on Tony's tail.  When you flick the tail, the disc flies onto his back and lands in one of the holes.  The first player to get three in a row wins.

For ages 3-7.

Name: The Games of GODZ
Description:
Subtitled "The Chameleon of Games", this is a game system for playing any of the 11 different games for which rules are supplied. Introduction text:

"The Games of GODZ is a unique and highly versatile game tool rather than a game in itself... the board is interpreted or subdivided in four different ways to allow the employment of different mathematical systems. Virtually all strategy game sin existence employ some method of mathematical logic thereby making it apparent "the Games of GODZ" is capable of utilizing many systems as the basis for a vast number of games.

The blocks are generally considered to be people and are therefore colored according to the four major races of the world. A block has an opening in one of its faces. This is used to indicate masculinity or femininity, depending on how it is placed on the board."

General rules explain different moves (where units move a number of squares equal to their value), "trick moves" (where units combine, merge, split, switch or piggyback), takes (capturing or converting the enemy), etc.. Specific rules tell which areas of the board are in play and what moves or takes are allowed. A deck of cards is used with some of the games.

Some games are mainly "movement" games, where the players have to move pieces into enemy or objective spaces, while others are "capture" games, where player have to kill all or specific enemy pieces. An interesting game in the set is "Cry", specifically for three players. One player plays with two other players, who are playing a different game, to score points by thwarting captures by either player - in effect, becoming a peacekeeper.

Game components:

- one board of 144 squares, divided into many colors and associations.
- 124 plastic blocks: 4 sets of 31 blocks each in red, white, yellow and black. Each set is made up of 16 "ones" (blocks are 1 cubic unit or 1x1x1), 8 "twos" (1x1x2), 4 "fours" (2x2x1), 2 "eights" (2x2x2) and 1 "sixteen" (2x2x4).
144 playing cards: 4 sets of 36 cards each marked in the same colors as the blocks (but not actually so colored) and with an associated letter (G for Brown, O for Red, D for White, and Z for Yellow). Cards are present in the same numbers as with the blocks, with five spares added to make 36 in a set.
- one booklet of 14 pages of general rules and specific rules, as well as rules on how to play Chess and Checkers with the game set.
- one sheet of directions on how to set up the first of the 11 games.

Name: The Gamers Constellation
Description:
At the beginning of the game only the "Moon" tile is on the "night sky" board, and players will progressively add "Stars" tiles to the  board. There are 3 different kind of Stars (4, 5 or 6 branches).

Each player has his own secret goal telling the shape of the Constellation he must realize on the board. To be valid, a Constellation must be made of only 1 type of Stars, and must include the Moon tile.

The winner is the first player who has his own Constellation appears on the board.

The Gamers Constellation uses the same game mechanics as Xochintlan and 6x5.

This game is available for free download on the author's website.

Note from the author: After having inserted this game in the BGG database, I realized there's another game named Constellation, from Hans van Halteren and published in 2003. The two games look very similar in many aspects... This is only pure coincidence !
Mine is derived from the original "Fountain of the King" that I originally designed in 1995, which transformed into Xochintlan, then 6x5, and now the Gamers Constellation. I thought this was a great and original idea ... well, my bad !

Name: Adventures in the Dungeon
Description:
Adventures in the Dungeon is a small Dungeon-Crawler originally published within "The Official Advanced Dungeons & Dragons Coloring Album."  The game's rules are cleverly placed at the bottom of each page, and are complimented by a map of the Dungeon in the center of the book.

The game is designed for 1-4 players, who will assume the role of characters seeking The Holy Talisman of St. Cuthbert.  The 4 characters (Paladin, Rangeress, Fighter, Wizard) each have different abilities.

To find the Talisman, players must wander the Dungeon and face the creatures therein.  Combat is simulated with 2D6, and the players roll attacks for both themselves and their monstrous opponents.  The various monsters have special abilities, and the characters will need to coordinate their efforts carefully to make it through.

Players win the Quest by finding the Talisman, and a scoring system is included based on how many monsters were slain, and how many characters survive.
Families: Versions & Editions: Board Game Versions of Role-Playing Games

Name: Coca-Cola Mini-Fußball
Description:
Two player soccer game, comes packed in what looks like a Coca Cola can.. Each player has one plastic field player and tries to score goals. The first player to reach 10 points, wins.

Contents: 
2 plastic soccer players
2 balls
1 soccer pitch (green mat with markings)
rules

Name: Hustled History
Description: This is a party game where the players are telling a story and adding 'mystery' words.  It is, according to the directions, "A Laughable Round Party Game".  It contains instructions and about 100 cards used during the storytelling of the game.

Name: Six by Six
Description: Six by Six is a game system from Kadon with a wooden board and four unique sets of pieces. The game has replaced Leap, an earlier Kadon game, but also is now greatly expandable to include several other games as included. These include maze games, maze solitaires, math gambits, and x-in-row designs. A very nice upgrade and nice new system for intriguing abstracts.

Name: Take a Number
Description: Take a Number is a game by Stephen Sniderman created for Kadon Games' 25th anniversary. It is actually 25 games in one, each nicely outlined in a thick rulebook. The rulebook also includes multiple solitaire games and math puzzles. This game is available on its own or is playable with Kadon's Six-by-Six game set.

Name: Boston T-Party
Description: Boston T-Party is a limited edition game (only 100 made)  and puzzle set from Kadon. The set includes 11 polyforms in unique shapes and three different colors. These can make four different t-shaped puzzles and numerous other figures. Like most Kadon polyform sets, the included guidebook includes many alternatives for use and game play.

Name: Grunt 3rd Edition: Fantasy Miniature Battles
Description:
First printed in 1996, in the years since Grunt has sold thousands and thousands of copies over four print versions (Original 1st edition, 2nd Edition, 2nd Edition: Deluxe and 2nd Edition: Deluxe 2 player Box Set). Now newly updated to Grunt 3rd Edition, this revised edition of Grunt has brought the game system back to its roots, a fast paced, easy to learn all purpose fantasy miniatures system thats extremely affordable.

Grunt is a unique miniatures system that focusses on army development, where you may recruit new units through the course of game play, plus have existing units gain experience points and levels. With expansion sets you can expand your army building options to include skills, abilities, expand your kingdom, customize your castles, add wizardry, monsters, magical items, develop heroes and immortals and more.


In this fashion, you strive to build up your army and kingdom over multiple battles (game sessions). You must weigh the costs to your army to achieve victory in your battle today against the gains victory can gain for your army for the long haul. 
Grunt 3rd Edition is a complete miniatures game system, including game rules, 45 Battle Cards, a castle template, city template, assorted cut-out Battlefield Markers, plus cut-out army units enough to field two complete armies. And, of course, you can always print out more as needed!.

Includes:
Cover + 38 pages
- Game Rules
- 45 Battle Cards
- Castle Template
- City template
- 2 Cut-Out Armies
- Assorted Battlefield Markers that include Supply, Traps, Cavalry, Fortifications, Fortresses, Scaling Ropes, Ballisti, Siege Towers, Castle Defenses, and Catapults.

Name: De Bonaparte à Napoléon
Description:
(from Histoire & Collections webpage:)

en français:
Règle complète pour le jeu avec figurines de 6 à 25 mm, pour la période 1792-1815. De Bonaparte à Napoléon — ou DBN — s’est affirmée comme la nouvelle règle de référence sur cette période épique. La première édition, rapidement épuisée, se trouve à présent remaniée et améliorée grâce à l’expérience des très nombreux joueurs pratiquant DBN. Cette seconde édition, désormais indispensable à tous, comprend les règles complètes amendées et des marqueurs sur planche cartonnée à découper.


(BGG user translation and description:)

In English:
Complete rules for 6 to 25mm miniatures games, 1792-1815 period. De Bonaparte à Napoléon — or DBN — has now became the new reference rule on this epic period. The first edition, quickly sold out, is now revised and improved thanks to the experience of many players practicing DBN. This second edition now indispensable to all, includes the complete rules amended and markers on cardboard sheets.


These rules are based in the DBX system (DBM, DBA, DBR, HOTT) but applied for the Revolutionary and the Napoleonic Wars into  army corps level. They cover the maneuvres, formations and combat of the period in a way which would be very familiar to those players of the before mentioned games.

IN FRENCH ONLY.

Name: Monaro City Racing Game
Description: Make your way around the chosen race route and be the first player to reach the checkered flag. Watch your fuel, beware of nasty weather conditions, manage pitstops, and avoid detours in your pursuit of glory.

Name: Straightaway
Description: Players race die-cast 5 laps around an oval track.  A standard D6 is used to determine for far your car moves.  The game includes marbles that are used to mark off the lap count of the lead car.

Name: Piecepack Letterbox
Description:
This game is based on the real-life outdoor sport of letterboxing.

Players hide "letterboxes" somewhere on the board and write clues for the other players. Everyone then attempts to find as many letterboxes as possible. A player gains victory points both when she finds other letterboxes and when other players find hers.

The game ends when one player has found all other letterboxes. The player with the most victory points is then the winner.

This game won the first Mesomorph Games Piecepack Competition in 2006, and is designed for a standard piecepack and the four seasons expansion.

Online Play


    Super Duper Games

Name: Hunt and Seek Worldwide
Description:
The game contains 4 double sided boards, with a detailed image of an exotic location from around the world printed on each side. There is also a set of cards displaying objects that can be found on every board. The objects are hidden within the images so that they mingle with the background, making them hard to spot.

At the beginning of the game, a single board is selected. On each turn, a card is turned face up and players try to spot the object as fast as possible. The first one to do so wins the card. The winner is the player who accumulated the most cards.

Name: The Search For The Graf Spee
Description:
From the publisher's catalog: "Once again the German pocket-battleship is loose in the South Atlantic and the British player faces the challenge of finding and bringing her to battle. Graf Spee comes complete with die-cut counters, rules booklet, battle board and two movement boards."

Another entry in the long line of AH Bismarck-style search and battle naval wargames, this one is very rare. As the name implies, it covers the search for the German "pocket battleship" Graf Spee in 1939.

With the usual low-quality Third Millenia components (especially the counters) and very simple rules, it is nevertheless a pretty fun game.

Like AH Bismarck, Midway, et al, movement and search are conducted on the two identical map sheets, and battles are resolved on the battle and charts sheet. Turn order is:
a. German player rolls for bad weather (no searches). German player moves.
b. British player searches.
c. British player moves.
d. German player searches.
e. If both in same hex, resolve battle.
f. When all battles are resolved, advance the turn record and start over.

The British can search the hexes ships are in, and one more hex within four hexes (search aircraft). Aircraft carriers (4 British and 1 French) can search the six adjacent hexes. The German player can search the hexes ships are in, plus the Graf Spee has two search aircraft that can search within four hexes. The German player can also search any other three hexes on the board (u-boat reports?).

Both players must keep track of fuel expenditures, and both have supply ships available to re-fuel (or they can re-fuel in ports). Every other turn the German player can roll on a table to sink one (or two) merchantmen. If he sinks any, he then rolls on another table to see how many turns later he must inform the British player in which hex the sinking occurred. The German player must sink a number of merchant ships and escape the map to win; otherwise the British player wins.

No indication is given of map or time scale. I suspect search board turns are one day. 20 turns to a game.

Components: two identical 14" x 24" hex-gridded search map sheets, one 14" x 24" battle and chart sheet, one rule folder (five small pages), plus 119 of 1/2-inch die-cut unit counters. 
I think there were 24 actual ship counters, some "?" s and "search" counters, and a bunch of blanks (my copy is unfortunately incomplete).

Name: Zatrikion
Description:
Byzantium is the name given to both the state and the culture of the Hellenic Empire in the middle ages. Both the state and the inhabitants always called themselves Hellenes/Roman, as did most of their neighbors. Western Europeans, who had their own Roman Empire called them Orientals or Greeks (Hellenes). Byzantion was the ancient name of the capital city and Byzantines after the former name of the Empire's capital city, Constantinople.

Zatrikion is the game of Byzantine chess. This chess has seven variations according to the more ancient board game of "Pessoi".

These versions have all the known pawns of the modern chess ("Mad Queen" was the first name) and in some variations there are many other pawns connecting to the philosophy of the Byzantine era.

Played with Byzantine Greek era letters for 2 players as the modern chess.
In some versions are three dices with the ancient shapes of Byzantium era and in this version the highest roll starts the game.

Zatrikion has the following items:
1. Seven colorful Boards (Grids).
2. The pawns of each player with different color. In Byzantium era the colors was the veneti (red color) and the greens (green color). These were the political parties in Byzantium era. 
3. Three dices with shapes.
4. Other material.
5. A book with some information for this game along with photos from the Byzantine era.

This board game will be soon in a new version.

Name: Dungeonation
Description:
Self-published Heroquest-like game.

This whole game is being redesigned from the ground up (2015).

Name: Listes d'armées pour De Bonaparte à Napoléon: Livret nº1 – Vive la Nation, 1792-1802
Description:
(from Histoire & Collections webpage:)

en français:
Compléments indispensables à la règle De Bonaparte à Napoléon, les trois livrets de Listes d'armées (au format standard 18 x 24 cm) présentent, sous forme de budget, la composition détaillée d'armées-type à destination des joueurs de DBN. Ce livret présente les armées des belligérants de la période révolutionnaire.


(BGG user translation and description:)

In English:
Essential supplements to the De Bonaparte à Napoléon (DBN) rule, the three Army lists booklets present, in form of budget, detailed typical armies for DBN players. This booklet presents the armies of the belligerents during the [French] revolutionary period.
 
Included are the royalists armies and the coalition armies which fought against France in the stated period. The last pages are dedicated to errata of army books 2 and 3. The system used here is similar to those of the army books for the DBx system of play.

IN FRENCH ONLY.

Name: Listes d'armées pour De Bonaparte à Napoléon: Livret nº2 – Les Annes de Gloire, 1805-1811
Description:
(from Histoire & Collections webpage:)

en français:

Compléments indispensables à la règle de jeux De Bonaparte à Napoléon (DBN), les trois livrets de Listes d'armées présentent, sous forme de budget, la composition détaillée d'armées-type à destination des joueurs de DBN. Ce second livret est consacré au début de l'Empire, de 1805 à 1811.


(BGG user translation:)

In English:

Essential supplements to the De Bonaparte à Napoléon (DBN) rule, the three Army lists booklets present, in form of budget, detailed typical armies for DBN players. This second booklet is devoted to the beginning of the [French] Empire, from 1805 to 1811.
 
IN FRENCH ONLY.

Name: Listes d'armées pour De Bonaparte à Napoléon: Livret nº3 – Les Années Terribles, 1812-1815
Description:
(from Histoire & Collections webpage:)

en français:

Compléments indispensables à la règle de jeu De Bonaparte à Napoléon (DBN), les trois livrets de Listes d'armées présentent, sous forme de budget, la composition détaillée d'armées-type à destination des joueurs de DBN. Ce troisième volet clot la série avec les années sombres de l'Empire, de 1812 à 1815.


(BGG user translation:)

In English:

Essential supplements to the De Bonaparte à Napoléon (DBN) rule, the three Army lists booklets present, in form of budget, detailed typical armies for DBN players. This third part ends the series with the [French] Empire's dark years, from 1812 to 1815.

IN FRENCH ONLY.

Name: Ring A-Round Mix and Match Word Game
Description: Turn the rings to mix and match letters and pictures.  The player who makes the most words wins.  Unique double sided game board offers multiple levels of challenge.

Name: Hi-Ho! Color Go-Round
Description: It's learning fun the Golden way as children match color dominoes along a spiraling color path.  Color recognition and matching skills are reinforced.  For ages 3 and up.

Name: Spell-A-Puzzle
Description: Shuffle all the tiles and give 5 to each player.  Place all the remaining tiles in the center face down.  Players race to find letters that match their words and the player who finishes all of their words first is the winner.  For ages 4 and up.

Name: Tactic Blue
Description:
Tactic Blue is a compilation of 6 abstract games by 3 different authors.  All of the games are played on a two-sided board, using the hex-grid or square-grid side.


     Accasta
     Abande
     Attangle
     Attraktion
     Alva
     International Checkers


Accasta, Abande, Attangle are games designed by Dieter Stein and are part of his stacking games trilogy. Attraktion, a game by Jaroslav Cichocki, uses pull force (attraction) in movement to form a winning condition.  Alva, designed by Alvydas Jakeliunas, is like a souped-up version of checkers.  The last game included is a classic International Checkers.  Apparently the gameboard and components happened to be compatible.  Some of the games were previously published on websites.

Name: MonkeyWinks
Description:
From the Three Monkey Games website:www.monkeypoker1.com

Once again, the geniuses at Three Monkey Games have turned a classic game on its ear and came up with something BRAND NEW! Introducing MonkeyWinks! The popular indoor game that is easy to learn for kids, and formidable enough to appeal to adults wanting a special challenge.

Like its predecessor, MonkeyWinks is a game played with sets of small, thin discs (called winks) lying on a special felt mat. Players use a larger disc (called a squidger) to pop a smaller disc into flight by pressing down on one side of the smaller disc. The basic goal of an informal game (easily playable by young children) is to cause the smaller discs to land inside a pot or cup. The formal game has a more robust set of rules, goals, and strategies suitable to serious competition for adults and older children.

MonkeyWinks is interactive fun for all players, pros and beginners alike. However, MonkeyWinks is a lot more than just a flipping disc game. For example, the included "Go Bananas"™ cards incorporate random events and player changes inspired by everyday kids games. 
www.monkeypoker1.com

Name: Monkey Poker
Description:
From Three Monkey Games website:www.monkeypoker1.com

Looking for a fun, new indoor game idea for children, and kids of all ages? Learn Poker along with Berry "The Bluffer" Bananahammock, "Fearless" Freddy Funkymunky, Albert "All In" Alexander and Mr. Bill "Bananas" Dole as they play this new and fun variation on the most popular card game in recent years: Texas Hold 'Em!

WHY MONKEY AROUND WITH A GOOD THING?!

MONKEY POKER™ takes the easy to learn card game Texas Hold 'em, and adds the entertaining randomness of such classic children's games as Monopoly™ and The Game of Life™. It's a great game idea for your next kid's party or sleepover!

The winner of each poker hand has to take a "Go Bananas!" card from a deck, and then do what the card says for bonus chi(m)ps!  The tasks range from the silly ("Take $1000 in Chimps from everyone, except for the person with the hairiest feet!") to the sublime ("Switch seats with the person to your left.  Now have the other monkeys do the same.").
The Chimps awarded by the "Go Bananas cards" can go either way, either to the winner or another player, so everyone has an equal chance of winning!

Plus with additional ways to win, MONKEY POKER™ is a hilariously fun card game with "a peel" for all ages! We guarantee you'll like it a bunch! www.monkeypoker1.com

Name: Atlantaopoly
Description:
Atlantaopoly is a game concerned with business trade in Atlanta. The object of the game is to accumulate as much wealth as possible through the purchase, trade, and development of businesses.

Board game spaces include Turner Broadcasting System, Friends of Zoo Atlanta, Atlanta History Center, The Carter Presidential Center, and Georgia-Pacific.

Players may improve their businesses by building high-rises (two, three, four, and five-story buildings) and eventually sky scapers.

Name: DBM Army Lists Book 1: 3000 BC to 500 BC
Description:
This book includes 63 armies from all around the world to use with the DBM rules. Most of them are from the Middle-East and eastern Mediterranean.
Each list is designed to produce 300 AP to 500 AP armies which closely simulate their real life prototype, while still allowing sufficient flexibility to cover historical variations during the period and legitimate differences of opinion or personal preference.

Name: DBM Army Lists Book 2: 500 BC to 476 AD
Description:
This book includes 84 armies from all around the world to use with the DBM rules. 
Each list is designed to produce 300 AP to 500 AP armies which closely simulate their real life prototype, while still allowing sufficient flexibility to cover historical variations during the period and legitimate differences of opinion or personal preference.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: DBM Army Lists Book 3: 476 AD to 1071 AD
Description:
This book includes 79 armies from all around the world to use with the DBM rules. 
Each list is designed to produce 300 AP to 500 AP armies which closely simulate their real life prototype, while still allowing sufficient flexibility to cover historical variations during the period and legitimate differences of opinion or personal preference.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: DBM Army Lists Book 4: 1071 AD to 1500 AD
Description:
This book includes 84 armies from all around the world to use with the DBM rules for the late middle-age to early renaissance. 
Each list is designed to produce 300 AP to 500 AP armies which closely simulate their real life prototype, while still allowing sufficient flexibility to cover historical variations during the period and legitimate differences of opinion or personal preference.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Harry Potter Championship Quidditch
Description:
In Harry Potter Championship Quidditch players take on the role of either Harry Potter or Draco Malfoy in a high-energy 1-on-1 version of author J.K. Rowling's magical sport. 
Each player must fire small red balls - quaffles - through rotating hoops in the center of the playing field. Each successful shot is worth ten points, but also more often than not gives the quaffle to your opponent. With eight quaffles flying back and forth, though, there's plenty to go around!
At a random point in the contest, the game will launch a gold ping-pong-esque ball - the Golden Snitch -  into the air. Whichever player catches the ball is awarded 150 points, and the game ends.
The game, which runs on two C batteries, provides sound effects during the game and also keeps track of the score, which can get into the thousands.

Name: I Love v. Ribbeck
Description:
" A game based on the ballad by Theodor Fontane. The garden is set up and the pears are distributed, depending on the number of players pears are put onto the tree, always at one side, or a player hands on pears to be put up. Pears must be taken with one hand and always from the same side, and be put onto a branch of the three. Depending on the variant, one harvests pears that fall from the unused side, and may keep them or give them away. The player with the most valuable pears after a preset number of rounds wins the game. Ballad printed in the rules.

Dexterity and tactical game * 2 or more players * no age given * Designer: Reinhold Wittig * Graphics: Karin und Reinhold Wittig * Edition Perlhuhn, Germany, 2005 *** Edition Perlhuhn * www.perlhuhn.de "

From www.spielen.at 2006/11/31

Name: ElectraWoman and DynaGirl Game
Description:
ElectraWoman & DynaGirl must reach the Secret Scientific Formula space in their ElectraCar and return to ElectraBase while using different combinations of Computer Power symbol cards to thwart the bad guys:  The Sorcerer, The Pharaoh, The Empress of Evil, The Spider Lady, Glitter Rock, and Ali Baba.

Each Trouble Space depicts a different combination of Computer Power symbols needed in order to overcome it.  Computer Powers include ElectraData, ElectraForce, ElectraBeam, and a few Super Power cards (a combination of all three).  If a player does not have the right combination of Computer Powers for that particular Trouble Space, they must remain in it until the correct combination is achieved.  A card is drawn every turn, regardless of whether a player can move.

Additional cards used to obstruct opposing players include ElectraPush and ElectraComp Blocked.

This game is based on the short-lived Sid and Marty Krofft live action children’s television series from 1976, starring Deidre Hall in her first major television role as ElectraWoman and Judy Strangis as DynaGirl.

Name: Newshound
Description:
Players seek to answer trivia regarding famous news stories dating back as early as 1900.  Categories include: 20th Century, 21st Century, Sports, Arts & Entertainment, and Science & Technology.

Victory is achieved by scoring five of one category, a 3/2 combination, or a run including each category, so players are awarded both for breadth of knowledge as well as expertise.

Of particular interest to trivia buffs is that each question, when answered, includes the story behind the headline.

"The game of strategy, fun, and fascinating facts."

www.newshoundgame.com

Name: The Vicksburg Campaign
Description:
April 1863
Union General Ulysses S. Grant embarks on another attempt to wrest control of the last major Confederate stronghold on the Mississippi River from the rebels; the fortress city of Vicksburg. Numerous other attempts have failed miserably. The ill-fated campaign from the north, short circuited by that devil Forrest's raid on Grant's supply lines. The jinxed canal, dug through the swamps in an attempt to bypass the city's guns. Now another plan is in motion. Grant will march his Army of the Tennessee through the Louisiana swamps, sneak his ships past the rebel fortress in a daring run of the gauntlet, conduct the largest amphibious invasion in U.S. history, separate himself from his supply base, wedge himself in between two rebel armies, and seize control of the city from the east! All the while battling politicians and public opinion as much as the Confederate armies. Somehow, his daring plan worked, and the Mississippi once again flowed unvexed to the sea.

But things could have been different. Find out how....

This operational level game uses the block unit system to re-create the limited intelligence of the actual campaign. Players maneuver their forces without adequate knowledge of their opponents strengths or even location. The game board spans the campaign topography, from the swamps of eastern Louisiana to the mountainous terrain around Jackson Mississippi. A point to point movement system is employed on a 20 x 24 playing map. Limited command abilities and critical supply wagons are key to managing your armies and achieving victory.

Name: Kruzno
Description:
Kruzno is an abstract strategy game usually played with two players on a hexagonally tiled board. Though the rules are extremely simple (three minutes to learn for most players), the number of possible moves and interactions are comparable to chess.

Kruzno uses standard chess pieces (bishops, knights and rooks) but is more closely related to hexagonal checkers and R.C. Bell's Jungle Game. Like the Jungle Game, capturing is non-transitive: bishops capture knights; knights capture rooks; rooks capture bishops. This split between offense and defense means that most standard strategies of move and capture have to be scrapped or reworked.

Game variants include versions with reduced number of pieces for faster play and expansion sets for three players.

Home Page: http://www.kruzno.com/

Name: Peepul Pals
Description: Card driven movement game for children. Based on the "Peepul Pals" line of books and dolls published by Whitman in the 1960's

Name: Blow Your Cool
Description:
Played on a large (approx 4 foot x 4 foot) vinyl mat.  Players try to blow plastic balls across another player's "loser line". You must try to prevent other player's ball from crossing your line or you earn 1 loser card.  Be careful if you touch your ball you earn 2 loser cards.

The game ends when the 45 loser cards are given out.  The player with the fewest cards wins.

Name: Gay Purr-ee Game
Description: Spin and move children's game.  Featuring the cats Jean-Tom and Mewsette traveling through Paris.

Name: Fun Fair Game
Description: Players race around the State Fair ground stopping at attractions to collect prizes.  Be the first player to collect 6 different prizes and you win.

Name: Regatta
Description: Spin and Move boat racing game.

Name: Gulf War
Description:
Gulf War is a Malaysian board game from 1990, using as its theme the then ongoing war in the Persian gulf. Its game mechanism is borrowed from An Qi (literally dark chess, because pieces are covered at the start and so unknown to the players: it is a game played using Xiangqi pieces). Each side has a number of pieces ranking from President down to Hostages or Civilians, and also Bombs, Fighter Planes and Oil-fields. Like An Qi (and for that matter games like LuZhanJunQi and Stratego), the pieces have a ranked order and higher ranked pieces eliminate lower ranked ones. Pieces start face-down and are randomly distributed in alternate colors on the 6X6 square grid that is the game board. Players take turn to expose pieces and once exposed, pieces may be moved one space orthogonally. Enemy pieces are eliminated by a higher or equal ranked piece moving on to them. There are special rules for specific pieces - the Assassin may eliminate the President, Bombs neutralize (i.e. both pieces get eliminated) all other pieces, capturing an Oil-field/Hostages/Civilians piece allows substitution of your own piece for a previously eliminated piece, etc. The Fighter Plane has the capture of the Pao (Cannon) in An Qi - just like in Xiangqi, it jumps over another piece to land on a distal piece and capture it. 
The game is won by the player who is able to capture both the opposing President and Vice-president.

The game has interesting details - one player takes the Iraqi side and the other is the Allied side. The President, Vice-president and Ally pieces are different and have pictures appropriate to the side (Saddam, Bush, Gaddfi and Thatcher all feature). Another difference is that the Iraqis have a Civilians piece but the Allied forces has a Hostages piece instead (in the game, they are equivalent). The board comes with two sides - one side has yellow and blue circles to show where the pieces go. The other has the same 6X6 grid superimposed on a background map showing the Persian gulf.

Name: Bozo the Clown Circus Game
Description:
Spin and move children's game.  Based on the TV show Bozo the Clown.  The board shows Bozo in the Circus,under the big top.

Climb the ladder, go across the high wire, if you fall there is a safety net, as you race to the finish line.

Name: World Tank Campaigns: Bulge
Description:
World Tank Campaigns (WTC) is a series of tactical games that employ cards, miniatures, and boards in a fast-playing action game designed primarly for solitaire, with one-on-one action as well. WTC is the brainchild of Dana Lombardy, designer of the award winning Streets of Stalingrad.

The game is card driven with dice used for combat and special actions.  Combat is represented on a tactical to operational level.

World Tank Campaigns: Bulge: Germany’s last gamble in the Ardennes to change the course of the war initially surprised the American forces, but it resulted in a major Allied victory. Each player play the role of a German or American tank commander directing a platoon of tanks with supporting forces.  The game plays out on a Battle Board unique to the scenario and tanks used in that scenario.

The World Tank Campaigns: Bulge Set has everything needed to play SOLITAIRE and 2-PLAYER games:


     2 historically accurate, incredibly detailed 1/144 scale plastic tanks
     Miniature tanks are pre-painted and fully assembled and include a historical information sheet about each tank
     2 full-color battle “boards” unique to the Ardennes and the Sherman M4A3 and Panther G tanks
     6 custom designed army-specic dice, plus standard d6 & d10
     88 full-color playing cards make gameplay fast and exciting
     55 die-cut play aid tokens (not show here), illustrated rulebook, and Quick Start Rules for the solitaire game


2 EXPANSION Sets include:


     22 additional cards, a Jagdpanzer IV tank-killer or King Tiger super heavy tank with their own unique battle boards and scenarios.


Home Page of the Game: http://www.world-tank-campaigns.com/
Home Page for the Miniatures: http://www.world-tank-museum.com/
Families: History: World War II (Battle of the Bulge)

Name: Yogi Bear: Go Fly a Kite Game
Description: Spin and Move Children's game.  Game Board featuring the animated characters of Yogi Bear, Boo-Boo Bear, Mr. Ranger, Quickdraw McGraw, Huckleberry Hound and others Flying kites.

Name: Arrest and Trial
Description:
Deduction game based on the ABC TV show "Arrest and Trial"  starring Ben Gazzara and Chuck Conners.

Move around the city collecting clues and questioning witnesses.

It is the same board and mechanics as "Dragnet".

Name: Dino the Dinosaur Game
Description: Spin and Move children's game based on the animated TV show "The Flintstones".

Name: The Detectives
Description: Deduction game based on the ABC TV show "The Detectives" starring Robert Taylor.  Players race around the board collecting clue's.  A spinner determines the location of the various clues.

Name: The Big Payoff
Description: A football board game that is designed to be played while watching actual games on TV.  Players place bets on the board indicating what play they think the offensive or defensive will make in the actual game.

Name: Hand 2 Hand
Description:
In Hand 2 Hand, players take turns drawing various things while other players attempt to guess what's being drawn.  Points are scored for correct guesses.

The trick is that partners must use the "double-handed drawing arm", working together to properly draw each subject.

Name: Money Maker
Description: Money Maker, A game of free enterprise.  Is a very monopoly like game that is used to market local businesses.  It consists of a gameboard, 2 dice, 4 pawns, a rules booklet, money in four denominations, a pad of Business Ownership and Expansion Record sheets, and a set of risk cards.  Rather than using houses and such to show ownership and improvement (as monopoly does) Branches are noted on the sheets.  On the gameboard all of the businesses are representations of local businesses.

Name: Firepower Pass
Description: Designed to easily control 15-20 capital ships a side (which can be 4-5 squadrons), while concentrating on squadron level tactics, Firepower Pass uses a unique command oriented system that allows units to attack as individual ships (i.e. at a tactical level) yet defend and maneuver in 3D as squadrons. Octagonal 3D movement tiles easily and elegantly depict the 2D vector of 3D movement.

Name: The AlphaPets Game
Description: This is a memory game where each player is trying to find and build the alphabet made of puzzle pieces of their chosen color.

Name: Go Diego Go!  Rescue the baby dinosaur
Description:
A themed Chutes & Ladders variant with some additions, like Rescue Pack squares that allow an extra roll, hang glider squares that allow (and force) the player to switch positions with someone else.  The board now goes to 91 and there's a dinosaur track on top.

Alternate cooperative rules are included with some interesting additional developments.

Includes board, rules, 6 pawns, 1 die, rubber dinosaur.

Name: Horse of the Year
Description: Board game based on Horse Show Jumping. The game has four plastic horses with riders, a variety of fences, walls and other items to make up the Show Jumping course on the board.

Name: Hell & Uncivil Disorder
Description:
Hell & Uncivil Disorder is a set of miniature wargame rules for Brushfire Wars and "Magic" in the 20th Century (there is also a Science Fiction option because Jim Webster is "happily confident our descendants will be as incompetent as we are").
The rules are suitable for use with a variety of figure scales (including a 1/300 variant) with a ground scale of approximately 20 yards to the inch.
The rules are intended for conflicts where first world forces are fighting third world forces and hence treats technology as magic (as per the well know Arthur C Clarke quotation) but may be used for any modern conflict.

Name: Imperial Commander
Description:
Imperial Commander is a set of miniature wargame rules for science fiction combat.  It was based around the Tabletop Figures range of 15mm Sci Fi figures and was designed to give a fast game when using around 50 figures per side.
The rules cover light infantry through to power armor, force shields and vehicles.  They also contain some army lists and conversions from Laserburn and Combat 3000.

Name: Wichita Scene
Description:
Get ready to experience the Wichita Scene!  Live and work at an exciting pace, make and break deals, buy and sell property, finance and liquidate businesses!

You'll get to establish proper connections with the planning director, influence the board of realtors, confront a Labor Leader and deal with the Downtown Revitalization Committee.

You may have thought Wichita doesn't have a scene... well, that may be true.  But now, YOU can live the dream!

Name: Semantic
Description: A game very much in the vein of Trivial Pursuit. Semantic requires players to answer questions based on the meaning of words. Players must complete a path around the board answering questions as they go. Movement is based on a dice roll.

Name: Our Navy
Description:
This game from the Wing National Game Company of St. Augustine, FLA was indeed copyrighted in 1898.

[The box says this game was published by Parker Brothers.]

The game consists of a Battle Ground with 31 Navy Paths (31 circles) each of which are intersected at 5 or 6 places by other paths. These intersections are called fighting positions.  Red, White and Blue designs across the battleground are called Line of Shot.

The game comes with 9 white and 9 black washers that represent Battleships from two Navies.

Each navy changes form (moves) in turn. Only one move is allowed at a time. The sinking of an opponents ship occurs when you manage to get two of your ships on the same line of shot as that of an enemy ship, with your nearest ship half way between the enemy and your back ship. When the range is so short that your two ships and the enemy lay in 3 consecutive positions then the enemy is captured and not sunk. When that happens you may remove the captured ship and place any of your ships in one of the starting positions. This allows you to fix placement errors by returning your ship to the start.

Name: Malin Baryard World Cup
Description:
Free translation from back of the box:

Do you dream about becoming a successful show jumping star just like Malin Baryard? In Malin’s own game WORLD CUP you get to test your talent in exciting jumping competitions. Initially you compete on a borrowed horse and try to collect enough prices to get all necessary equipment and a horse of your own. With that accomplished you just have to win one final competition to become the World Cup champion. All you need is luck, a bit of tactics and some horse knowledge.

Event cards and trivia questions make the game full of action and lots of fun. You also get to ride different horses and the better you perform the better horses you get to ride. Many of the available horses are "celebrities" and if you are really good you might even get to jump Butterfly Flip!

Good luck!

Malin Baryard

Name: König und Konsorten
Description:
It´s a little like the German game "Mau Maus" resp. "UNO".
There are four colors with 18 cards, of 5 types including the law cards. Also there jokers.
You start the game with 12 coins and every round with 6 hand cards. The game ends when one player has no more money left at the end of a round. The player with the most money wins.
On your turn you place a card on the discard pile. It has to match the color or the type of the last card. If you can´t place a card you have to draw a new one. If you can´t place it either your turn ends.
The round ends when one player has no more cards. Leftover cards cost you money and round end law cards are applied.
The law-cards help you or force other players to do silly things every turn or get a disadvantage during the round or at the end of it.
Some of the cards have instant effects on them.

box-inventory
82 cards
60 coins (gold and silver)
rules

Name: La llotja
Description:
After a very long night of fishing the boats replete with fish return to the port. In the Strap begins the auction of all the apprehensions, every player is interested in obtaining the highest price, and of all those more species better, spending the less amount of money.

A game of fishing auctions for from 3 to 6 players. It consists of 40 cards, 5 for each of the species and 90 coins.

Name: Mensch Natur Technik
Description:
A tactical dice-game for Hannover's places of interest, from Bothfield to Kirchrode.
"People Nature Technology" was the motto of the 2000 Hannover expo.


Ein taktisches Würfelspiel zu Hannoverschen Sehenswürdigkeiten von Bothfeld bis Kirchrode.
"Mensch Natur Technik" war das Motto der Expo 2000 in Hannover.

Name: Der Top Aktionär
Description:
In Top Aktionär (Top Stockholder) the goal is to become the richest player in the defined play-time.  To achieve this goal, players buy and sell stock.    Whoever buys stock, gets shares and then must pay dividends.  In the game,it is possible to purchase many stocks, and to unexpectedly be tossed out of control by other players.


Bei Top Aktionär geht es darum, nach Ablauf der festgesetzten Spielzeit der reichste Spieler zu sein.
Zu diesem Zweck kauft und verkauft man Aktien. Wer Aktien besitzt, erzielt Einnahmen und muss auch Dividenden zahlen.
Im Spiel geht es darum, möglichst viele Aktien zu erwerben, aber auch immer für unerwartete Ausgabengerüstet zu sein.

Name: Reefer City
Description:
Be the king of Pot, Hash and 'Shrooms.  You roll dice and progress around the board.  In the process you 'make connections' wherein you can buy and sell illegal commodities. 
The Market Level for commodity prices will vary as the game goes on.  Be the first to accumulate $20,000 and you win!

Name: The Bee Safe or Bee Sorry Game
Description:
The Bee Safe or Be Sorry Game helps kids be aware of dangers. It features "Stinger" and "Buzzie".

The age recommendation is 4 and up.

The players are represented by playing pieces which are shapes, a square, a circle, a triangle, and a rectangle.  There are Honeycomb cards, Stinging Bee cards, Safety First cards, Buzzie Bee cards, Safehouse cards, Stranger Cards, and a spinner.

Players start with three Honeycomb cards and move about the board drawing the other cards.  The other cards have situations on them that are to be read and then directions to either move (forwards or backwards) and/or draw/lose Honeycomb cards.  The situations all have to do with safety.

Th winner is the first to reach the hive first or obtain 15 Honeycomb cards!

Name: Yellowstone Treasure Quest
Description: This is a trivia game based on Yellowstone Park - the object to collect unique sets of park "treasures (which are cards of photos for example).  Each trivia question has 3 level of difficulties.
